title: Robert Badinter's legacy: 'A courageous vision of political action'

quotes: Former justice minister Robert Badinter and President François Hollande, during a ceremony honoring the French Resistance, in the Paris suburb of Suresnes, on February 21, 2014.
With his induction into the Panthéon on Thursday, October 9, Badinter, the architect of France's abolition of the death penalty, has become something of a commanding figure:
a former justice minister (1981-1986), above all left behind 'a courageous vision of political action.'
except for his election to the Sénat in 1995.
Libertés, Libertés ('Freedoms, Freedoms'), a slim book published by the Committee for a Charter of Freedoms, led by Badinter, in 1976,
